ALLEGATION:
It is alleged that Youth A was restrained without justification.
INVESTIGATION:
On March 2, 2022, a special investigation was initiated into the allegation described
above. Staff and youth were interviewed. Documents were reviewed including a
video recording of the incident. What follows is information obtained from the
aforementioned sources.
On March 2, 2022, the Program Director was informed of the allegations and that a
special investigation was initiated.
On March 2, 2022, Youth A, the alleged victim in this case, was interviewed. Youth A
reported she walked from the living room to the dining room and had not received
permission from staff to leave the living room. Youth A reported Staff 1 followed her
and took hold of her arm while she was in the dining room. Youth A reported she
“yanked” her arm away from the hold Staff 1 had on her arm. Youth A reported Staff
1 initiated a restraint, grabbing her from behind. Youth A reported she was struggling
against the restraint as she and Staff 1 moved into the kitchen. Youth A reported she
was trying to get away from Staff 1. Youth A reported she and Staff 1 were moving
across the kitchen towards the kitchen sink as she was trying to break the hold of
Staff 1. Youth A reported while in the restraint she told Staff 1 to get off from her.
Youth A was asked if she had been making threatening comments towards Staff 1
and she denied she had, reiterating she was telling Staff 1 to get off from her. Youth
2

A reported Staff 2 told Staff 1 to let her go which he then did. Youth A reported she
sat on the kitchen floor and Staff 2 and Staff 3 helped to settle her down.
On March 2, 2022, Staff 2, the agency Medical Tech was interviewed. Staff 2
reported she was in another room when she heard Youth A yelling. Staff 2 entered
the kitchen and reported she saw Staff 1 was attempting to control Youth A while he
had her in a restraint. Staff 2 reported she then said to Staff 1, “I got this” and Staff 1
released his hold on Youth A and walked out of the kitchen and Youth A sat on the
floor. Staff 2 reported she and Staff 3 talked with Youth A to settle her down. Staff 2
reported she felt Youth A was not out of control and therefore she felt it was safe for
Staff 1 to release his hold on Youth A. Staff 2 stated, “If I felt that Youth A was really
out of control I would have assisted with the restraint.” Staff 2 reported she did not
hear any threatening comments from Youth A, only that she was telling Staff 1 to let
go of her. Staff 2 reported she had concerns about why “hands on” had started as
Youth A was not out of control.
On March 2, 2022, Staff 3, an agency Case Manager, was interviewed. Staff 3
reported that initially she saw Staff 1 take hold of Youth A’s bicep in the dining room.
Staff 3 reported Youth A pulled her arm away from Staff 1 and headed from the
kitchen with Staff 1 following. Staff 3 reported Staff 1 then took hold of Youth A from
behind attempting to use an upper torso hold and Youth A is struggled to break the
hold. Staff 3 reported Youth A yelled “get the fuck off me, leave me alone”. Staff 3
reported Staff 2 then told Staff 1 to let go of Youth A and he subsequently did, and
Youth A dropped to the floor. Staff 3 reported she and Staff 2 talked with Youth A to
de-escalate her. Staff 3 reported she did not hear Youth A threaten Staff 1 or
become assaultive. Staff 3 reported Youth A has not had any assaultive or property
damage incidents since placed at the agency. Staff 3 reported she felt the restraint
was unjustified.
On March 2, 2022, Youth B was interviewed. Youth B reported she was in the dining
room when Youth A entered. Staff 1 grabbed her on her bicep. Youth A broke the
hold and started for the kitchen when Staff 1 put Youth A into a standing restraint.
Youth B reported Youth A was telling Staff 1 to let her go and to stop touching her.
Youth A reported she observed the restraint when it started and could see the
restraint through the open window area between the dining room and kitchen. Youth
B reported she heard Staff 2 tell Staff 1 to let go of Youth A which he did. Youth B
reported she did see Youth A becoming assaultive or hear her making threats
towards staff.
On March 15, 2022, Staff 1, was interviewed. Staff 1 is a Safety and Security 111 (?)
. Staff 1 reported on the day of the incident, Youth A had been oppositional and was
not following staff directives. Staff 1 reported Youth A had “been walking out of step”,
meaning that she would leave a room without permission. Staff 1 reported Youth A
had left the living room and was walking into the dining room when he attempted a
hook transport to return her to the living room. Staff 1 reported he then attempted an
upper torso hold as Youth A moved into the kitchen. Staff reported he saw Staff 2 in
3

the kitchen and Youth A began crying and he released the hold. Staff 1 reported
Youth A, prior to the incident, had been making threats such as “Don’t try me” and
“You better not bother me”. Staff 1 reported there were other threats, but he could
not remember specifics. Staff 1 reported he was concerned about Youth A getting
something in the kitchen but remarked that kitchen utensils are usually not left laying
out for youth to have access to. Staff 1 reported he could not remember what Youth
A might have been saying during the restraint or what Staff 2 or Staff 3 had said.
DOCUMENT REVIEW:
Video Review: On March 2, 2022, a video recording of the incident was reviewed.
Staff 1 is seen to take hold of the arm of Youth A while they were in the dining room.
Youth A is observed to yank her arm away from the hold of Staff 1 and then enter
the kitchen. Staff 1 is observed to take hold of Youth A from behind as Youth A
struggles against the hold. Staff 2 is observed in the kitchen and Staff 1 releases the
hold and walks away from the kitchen. Youth A drops to the floor and Staff 2 and
Staff 3 are observed talking with Youth A. The duration of the restraint is very brief.
Incident Report: An agency incident report dated February 23, 2022, and written by
Staff 1, was reviewed. The incident report does not add additional information except
that Youth A was threatening him and there was concern that Youth A would obtain
items she could hurt herself with.
MISACWIS Incident Review: A review of incident reports involving Youth A
indicates that she has not been assaultive or engaged in self harm while in the
program. The February 23, 2022, incident is the only one documented in the system.
APPLICABLE RULE
R 400.4159 Resident restraint.
(4) The written policy shall only permit the licensee to
restrain a child for the following circumstances:
(a) To prevent injury to the child, self-injury, or injury to
others.
(b) As a precaution against escape or truancy.
(c) When there is serious destruction of property that
places a child or others at serious threat of violence or
injury if no intervention occurs.
4

ANALYSIS: Staff 2 reported that she did not feel that Youth A was out of
control and asked Staff 1 to release his hold of her. Staff 2
reported that she did not hear Youth A making threats to others.
Staff 3 reported that she felt the restraint was unjustified as
Youth A was not engaging in harm to self or others. Staff 3 did
not hear Youth A making threats to Staff 1 or others.
Youth A reported that she was not making threats to Staff 1 or
others.
Youth B did not hear Youth A making threats or being
assaultive.
The video recording does not establish that Youth A was being
assaultive, engaging in self harm, or destroying property, any of
which would necessitate a restraint.
The restraint was unjustified.
CONCLUSION: VIOLATION ESTABLISHED
IV. RECOMMENDATION
It is recommended, based on the findings of Special Investigation 2022C0128019
the license be modified to a first provisional license.
